title: Kobe Steel says data tampering scandal caused steel order cuts, but not aluminium
text:
April 27, 2018 / 8:25 AM / Updated 28 minutes ago Kobe Steel says data tampering scandal caused steel order cuts, but not aluminium Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
TOKYO (Reuters) - Japanâ€™s Kobe Steel Ltd said that its data tampering scandal resulted in some cuts for orders for its steel products, but has not affected aluminium sales, Kobe Steel Managing Executive Officer Kazuaki Kawahara told a news conference. FILE PHOTO: The Kobe Steel (Kobelco) headquarters building is seen in Kobe, western Japan October 24, 2017. REUTERS/Thomas White/File Photo
The company has slowed the production of aluminium products as it needed to make sure all the specifications were met, he added.
($1 = 109.3700 yen)
